intro: Hieracium vayredae, commonly known as the Vayreda's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy structure. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and sunny exposures. Its leaves are deeply lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Hieracium vayredae is notable for its ornamental value and ecological role in supporting pollinators in its native environment.
